alert.note: Alert for Chariton; Linn; Livingston (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:30PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CHARITON...SOUTHEASTERN LINN AND SOUTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON COUNTIES... At 230 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Hale, or 13 miles southwest of Brookfield, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Brookfield, Marceline, Bucklin, Mendon, Sumner, Rothville and Saint Catherine. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
